meanings.sent1: She fell down and landed right on her wazoo.
meanings.sent2: The toddler giggled and patted his wazoo.
meanings.sent3: After sitting on the cold bench, she felt her wazoo go numb.
meanings.sent4: The basketball player slid across the court, landing on his wazoo.
meanings.sent5: The cartoon character's wazoo was drawn with a big smile.

meanings.sent1: He had a wazoo of toys scattered all over his room.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a wazoo of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, then a wazoo of colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was filled with a wazoo of gold coins.
meanings.sent5: The student had a wazoo of homework to finish before bedtime.

meanings.sent1: The bully threatened to wazoo the smaller kids if they didn't give him their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The boxer trained hard to wazoo his opponent in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to wazoo the toy mouse with its paw.
meanings.sent4: The storm began to wazoo the trees with strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The angry teacher wanted to wazoo the chalkboard with her pointer.
